body_html:
@av8ramit That's really unfortunate – i recently got myself a 1080 Ti and thought that with the 11 GB VRAM i can finally run all the stuff my older card couldn't lift. And i have just discovered Tensorboard ... Now i can only:

  1. Downgrade >= 1.2 TF only functions/code back to 1.1 (won't work for long 😬)
  2. Search for implementations of a TF project in Keras (Theano), pyTorch/Torch etc.
  3. Rewrite TF only projects from scratch with another framework
  4. Put the GPU in a separate Machine with Linux ...
  5. Sell my body and/or organs so i can afford a 128 Core Xeon Machine

I currently have a working 1.1 GPU install – can i just make a copy of all files in my python site-packages/tensorflow folder if i want to try out Tensorflow >=1.2 (CPU only ofc) and then revert back?

Have you seen if someone has managed to build TF 1.2 with GPU support from source? What is the biggest obstacle/time consuming issue that forced the TF team to drop Mac GPU support?
